overview: This subject will provide an overview of the ways that music can be used to promote physical health and healthy behaviours for a range of people. Topics covered will include music for expression, relaxation, anxiety reduction and communication.

Students will be involved in experiential activities underpinned by theoretical knowledge. They will also contribute to weekly web-based discussion that furthers understanding of topics covered in class.
This subject is co-delivered with MUSI10237 Music and Health, MUSI20150 Music and Health and MUSI90188 Music and Health Research.
intended learning outcomes: identify areas for musical development outside the technique/competency spectrum;
skills in using music to reduce anxiety and improve communication in others;
critically appraise the relationship between music and health.

assessments.description: Weekly participation in web-based quiz. 45 hours (of work required)

Semester 2.Contact hours: 36 hours, comprising one 1-hour tutorial, and 2-hours engaging in online learning activities per week.

Prescribed texts: Levitin, D.J.The world in six songs: How the musical brain created human nature. London: Dutton Publishers, 2008.
